page.title: 01GREENHALGH/ROSEACRE - REVIEW
page.content:
This block is a pastoral, rural area with predominant dairy farming, but with a small amount of arable land for corn or root crops. Sheep, beef and dairy cattle graze in the summer and are housed indoors in winter.
Tenanted farm land tends to be amalgamated with larger units, when it becomes vacant. This has led to a change of use for redundant buildings. These are being converted into larger than average detached houses. This has brought more high salaried people into a fairly simple rural community.
Workers in this area commute, for example to ICI Thorton, BNFL Salwick, B.Ae Warton and Preston. Fewer people are employed on the land due to change and mechanisation. Some of these workers still live in tied cottages.
